title: Manny Pacquiao plans one final fight before retiring [Video]
text:
Manny Pacquiao plans one final fight before retiring 
The Sports Xchange Report an error 
The final bell is in sight for Manny Pacquiao. 
The eight-time world champion will fight one last time on April 9 before retiring and continuing his political career in his home country, the Philippines. 
According to Top Rank promoter Bob Arum, the two had dinner last week in New York and the 36-year-old Pacquiao discussed his future plans. 
"Manny told me this would be his last fight and I'm not sad about it because he's going on to a political career, which will require a lot of mental acuity, so you don't want him to stay in boxing too long," Arum told ESPN. "We talked very seriously and he said, 'Bob, hopefully, by the middle of May I will have been elected senator in the Philippines and at that point I cannot engage in boxing because I need to focus on the senate and I have to be in attendance." 
Pacquiao, who turns 37 in December, is a congressman but plans to run for one of 24 national senate seats. 
Pacquiao (57-6-2, 38 KOs) has won world titles at flyweight, junior featherweight, featherweight, junior lightweight, lightweight, junior welterweight, welterweight and junior middleweight. 
His opponent for the April fight has not been announced. The three names mentioned most are Terence Crawford, Amir Khan and Timothy Bradley. 
Not long after Pacquiao is expected to hang up his gloves, rival Floyd Mayweather has said he will retire. Sponsored Links
